column4: Hey guys I have some problems. Anyone know how to fix my system so it's dual boot Vista-Ubuntu?
Well I had XP on it previously and it was working fine with Ubuntu. But it finally cratered on me so I reinstalled Ubuntu since I don't have a Windows disc.
But now I have a Vista disc and it wont boot from the disc.
Also, gparted isn't detecting another harddrive.
Exactly nikrud. But it wont detect it in Ubuntu. So I cant reformat it. And like I said booting from it isn't working.
goose isn't that the desktop it comes with?
Gparted doesn't detect the NTFS partition of my first HD. So I can't reformat it.
Also, booting from the DVD(for Vista) doesn't work.
It only gives me the info on harddriveb. It doesn't show harddrivea.
which is it?
which way is it, vista or ubuntu not booting?
probably looking to install on the first partition on the first drive.
what do you mean, wont
detect what?
hm. When you say doesn't detect it, you mean it says that the first partition starts after ntfs?  what does   sudo fdisk -l   say
I mean , which is the "it" you're talking about, gparted or sudo fdisk -l ?
then the disk itself is not responding. Check the cabling
no. if fdisk doesn't see it, you have bad disk/cabling , hardware issues
check your cabling and all first.
you would have to resize your ext3 partition, leaving some space on the front. gparted ____should____ be able to do that
you'll need to boot to a live cd to change those partitions, you can't resize when they are mounted/in use
there's a live gparted disk out there if you don't have the ubuntu live
